types.name: Account
types.description: Account Information

fields.name: handle
fields.description: account handle, identifier for the account

types.name: ActionHookFilter
types.description: Filter for the Action Hook log.

inputFields.name: statuses
inputFields.description: Filter by Action Hook status

inputFields.name: types
inputFields.description: Filter by Action Hook types

types.name: ActionHookLog
types.description:
Action Hook Log represents a recorded Action Hook HTTP request to a customers web servers.
Log entry may contain information about a pending, successful or failed request.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Headers sent with the Action Hook request.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the Action Hook request.

types.name: ActionHookLogConnection
types.description:
Datatype to group together 'connected' Action Hook logs
based on page information.

types.name: ActionHookLogEdge
types.description: Datatype encapsulating an Action Hook log entry and its cursor.

types.name: ActionHookStatus
types.description: Status of the Action Hook request.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Action Hook request failed.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Action Hook request is queued to be sent.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: Action Hook request was successfully sent.

types.name: ActionHookSubscription
types.description:
Action Hook subscription contains subscriber registration information.
Action Hook is an action that occurs when an event happens.
Action can be an HTTP POST request that will be triggered to customers web servers.

fields.name: action
fields.description: Name of the basta action that is being subscribed to.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Custom HTTP header values sent with the action Action Hook.

types.name: ActionHookSubscriptionInput
types.description: Input to create an Action Hook subscription.

inputFields.name: action
inputFields.description: Events that trigger the action.

inputFields.name: headers
inputFields.description: Custom HTTP header values sent with the action.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: Webhook URL that is called when Action Hook is triggered.

types.name: ActionType
types.description: Action types (events) that can trigger Action Hooks.

enumValues.name: BID_ON_ITEM
enumValues.description: Event: When bid on any item associated with your account occurs in the system.

enumValues.name: ITEMS_STATUS_CHANGED
enumValues.description: Event: When an item status change associated with your account occurs in the system.

enumValues.name: ITEMS_UPDATED
enumValues.description: Event: When 1 or more item in a sale change associated with your account.

enumValues.name: SALE_STATUS_CHANGED
enumValues.description: Event: When a sale status change associated with your account occurs in the system.

types.name: AddItemToSaleInput
types.description: Add a current item to a sale.

inputFields.name: ItemNumber
inputFields.description: Item number is used to order items (optional)

inputFields.name: allowedBidTypes
inputFields.description:
Allowed BidTypes on the item.
Currently only a single BidType is allowed per item.
Defaults to allowing only Max bids if not supplied.

inputFields.name: bidIncrementTable
inputFields.description: Optional bid increment table for this item.

inputFields.name: highEstimate
inputFields.description: High estimate of the item (optional) in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: Item id of the item that you are adding to the sale.

inputFields.name: lowEstimate
inputFields.description: Low estimate of the item (optional) in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: reserve
inputFields.description: Reserve of the item in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: saleId
inputFields.description: Id of the sale that is associated with the item.

inputFields.name: startingBid
inputFields.description: Starting bid of the item in minor currency unit.

types.name: ApiToken
types.description:
API token represent a token that allows
customers to access the API in machine and machine manner.

types.name: ApiTokenCreated
types.description:
Created API token represent a token that allows
customers to access the API in machine and machine manner and includes
the API key that the caller needs to write down (not able to see the key again)

types.name: ApiTokenInput
types.description: Input object for when creating a API token

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the API token

inputFields.name: role
inputFields.description: Role associated to API token

types.name: ApiTokenRole
types.description: Role that authorize api tokens

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: ADMIN HAS UNRESTRICTED ACCESS

enumValues.name: READ
enumValues.description: READ HAS READ ONLY ACCESS

types.name: Bid
types.description: A bid on a item

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount of the bid in minor currency unit.

fields.name: bidSequenceNumber
fields.description:
Bids sequence number tells us how bids are connected.
Bids with the same bid sequence number happend during the same Bid/Max-bid request.
Mainly used for cancelling bids.

fields.name: bidStatus
fields.description: Bid status of currently logged in user for this item

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date of when the bid was placed.

fields.name: maxAmount
fields.description: Max amount of the bid in minor currency unit.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: Users id that placed the bid

types.name: BidIncrementTable
types.description:
Bid increment table represent how increments behave for a
specific item or a sale.

types.name: BidIncrementTableInput
types.description: Bid increment table input, to control increments in a sale.

types.name: BidOnBehalfInput
types.description: Bid on behalf of a user in a sale.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: bid amount of the bid in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: item id of the item

inputFields.name: saleId
inputFields.description: The sale id which the item belongs that is being bidded on

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type represent what kind of bid is being placed on an item.

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: user id of the user that bid is being placed for.

types.name: BidStatus
types.description: Bid statuses that calculates in what status the bid is.

enumValues.name: LOSING
enumValues.description: User is losing the item.

enumValues.name: LOST
enumValues.description: User has lost the item.

enumValues.name: NOT_BIDDING
enumValues.description: User is not bidding on the item

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: User submitted an offer successfully

enumValues.name: WINNING
enumValues.description: User is winning the item.

enumValues.name: WITHDRAWN
enumValues.description: User's bid has been withdrawn

enumValues.name: WON
enumValues.description: User has won the item.

types.name: BidType
types.description: Bid Type represent what kind of bid is being placed on an item.

enumValues.name: MAX
enumValues.description:
Bid is the highest amount a user is willing to pay. The auction
engine will automatically place the lowest bid necessary on behalf
of the user until the max amount is reached.

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: Bid is a normal bid.

enumValues.name: OFFER
enumValues.description: Bid is an offer that the user commits to buying the item for.

types.name: BidderToken
types.description:
Bidder token is a token that is signed on behalf a user.
The token returned will allow users to bid on items.

types.name: BidderTokenInput
types.description: Bidder token input, when generating a bidder token.

inputFields.name: metadata
inputFields.description: Required metadata that needs to be included to generate a bidder token.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: CancelLatestBidOnItemInput
types.description:
Cancel latest bid on an item.
Caution: Be careful when using this operation. Multiple requests will end in multiple
placed bids to be cancelled.
Cancel latest bid will remove the latest bid and any reactive bid placed.
This results in 1 or 2 bids being cancelled per call.

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: Item ID of the item

inputFields.name: saleId
inputFields.description: Sale ID of the sale that includes the item in scope.

inputFields.name: sequenceNumber
inputFields.description: Bid sequence number of the latest bid.

types.name: CanceledLatestBidOnItem
types.description: Response when canceling latest bid on item

types.name: CloseSaleInput
types.description: Input object for when forcing sale to close.

types.name: ClosingMethod
types.description: ClosingMethod represents how SaleItems are moved into CLOSING status and when they are CLOSED

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description:
No sniping.
All items close at the same time as the sale

enumValues.name: ONE_BY_ONE
enumValues.description:
Only one item is in status CLOSING at once.
Other items wait in status OPEN.

enumValues.name: OVERLAPPING
enumValues.description:
Each item has a precalculated closing time.
Default if ClosingMethod is not specified.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: description to be displayed on account profile as bio

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: email

inputFields.name: handle
inputFields.description:
identifier for the account
If provided then it has to between 3-20 charachters long.
Autogenerated if left empty.
Accepted symbols for handles:
  * lowercase alphabetical letters a-z
  * numbers 0-9
  * special charachter _ (underscore)

inputFields.name: links
inputFields.description: links associated with the account

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: name

types.name: CreateItemInput
types.description: Item input when creating an item

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Description for describing the item

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Title for describing the item

inputFields.name: valuationAmount
inputFields.description: Valuation of the item in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: valuationCurrency
inputFields.description: Valuation currency

types.name: CreateSaleInput
types.description: Input for creating or modifying sales.

types.name: DeleteActionHookSubscriptionInput
types.description: Input to delete an Action Hook subscription.

inputFields.name: action
inputFields.description: Event that triggers the action.

types.name: DeleteItemInput
types.description: Input object for when deleting a item (including unassociating from a sale)

types.name: DeleteSaleInput
types.description: Input object for when deleting a sale.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: HttpHeader
types.description:
HttpHeader contains custom http request header information to be included in Action Hooks.
All Action Hooks are sent with the {"Content-Type": "application/json"} header by default.

types.name: HttpHeaderInput
types.description: Input to include custom header key-value pairs with Action Hook requests.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Image
types.description: Image object

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the image, UUID string

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: saleId
fields.description: Sale Id, if the item is linked to a sale

fields.name: valuationAmount
fields.description: Valuation of the item in minor currency units.

types.name: ItemFilter
types.description: Item filter

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Filter by item title

types.name: ItemStatus
types.description: Item statuses for items in a sale

types.name: MaxBidOnBehalfInput
types.description: Max bid on behalf of a user in a sale.

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: item id of the item

inputFields.name: maxAmount
inputFields.description: max bid amount of the bid in minor currency unit.

inputFields.name: saleId
inputFields.description: The sale id which the item belongs that is being bidded on

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: user id of the user that bid is being placed for.

fields.name: addItemToSale
fields.description: Add a currently existing item to a sale.

fields.name: bidOnBehalf
fields.description: Bid on behalf of a user

fields.name: cancelLatestBidOnItem
fields.description: Cancel the latest bid on item (including reactive bids that were placed as a side-effect)

fields.name: createApiToken
fields.description: Create an API key, that can access all functions in the API on behalf of the logged in customer.

fields.name: createBidderToken
fields.description: Create and sign a token that can be used to bid on behalf of a user (unique user id needs to be provided)

fields.name: createItem
fields.description: Create item. This operation will create a standalone item that is not part of a sale.

fields.name: createItemForSale
fields.description: Create item and add to a sale. This operation will automatically create an item and add it to the sale.

fields.name: forceStartClosingSale
fields.description: Start to close the sale, forcefully

fields.name: maxBidOnBehalf
fields.description:
Max bid on behalf of a user
@deprecated(reason: "Use bidOnBehalf with type as MAX")

fields.name: removeItemFromSale
fields.description: Remove an item from the sale. This will not delete the item completely.

fields.name: revokeApiToken
fields.description: Revoke the API key by id.

fields.name: setItemWinner
fields.description: Sets sale item winner. Marks bid as won and closes item. Used in offer model.

fields.name: setSaleItemStatus
fields.description: Sets sale item status. Used in offer model to close item with no winner.

fields.name: startClosingSale
fields.description: Start to close the sale, non forcefully

fields.name: testActionHook
fields.description: Test ActionHook configuration. This will trigger an action hook to be sent.

fields.name: updateItem
fields.description: Update item. This will update information about items for all sales that has not been closed.

fields.name: updateItemForSale
fields.description: Update item associated with a sale.

types.name: OpenSaleInput
types.description: Input object for when forcing sale to open.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Page info for pagination

types.name: PaginationDirection
types.description: Direction of pagination

types.name: Participant
types.description:
Participant represent a bidder in a sale, it will be automatically created
when the user starts bidding on a sale.

types.name: PublishSaleInput
types.description: Input object for when forcing sale to published.

fields.name: apiTokens
fields.description: Get API Keys that have created.

fields.name: items
fields.description:
Get all items for accountId

onlyMyItems if true filters items belonging to the current user

fields.name: sales
fields.description: Get all sales that have been created.

types.name: RangeRule
types.description:
Range rule explains increments in the table.
Represented as minor currency units.

types.name: RangeRuleInput
types.description:
Range rules input in an increment table.
Values should be in minor currency units.
If a sale has USD as currency then the minor currency unit is cents.
The rule [hihgRange: $1000, lowRange: $0, step: $25] should be sent as
  [highRange: 100000, lowRange: 0, step: 2500]

inputFields.name: highRange
inputFields.description: High range of the rule in minor currency units.

inputFields.name: lowRange
inputFields.description: Low range of the rule in minor currency units.

inputFields.name: step
inputFields.description: Step of the rule in minor currency units.

types.name: RemoveSaleItemInput
types.description: Input to remove an item from a sale

inputFields.name: itemId
inputFields.description: Item id of the item that you are removing from the sale.

inputFields.name: saleId
inputFields.description: Id of the sale that is associated with the item.

types.name: RevokeApiTokenInput
types.description: Input object for when revoking a API token

inputFields.name: apiTokenId
inputFields.description: API token Id that needs to be revoked

types.name: Sale
types.description: Sale

fields.name: accountId
fields.description: Account ID associated with the sale

fields.name: closingTimeCountdown
fields.description:
ClosingTime countdown is the sniping duration in milliseconds.
If not provided it defaults to 120000 (2 minutes).
If a sale has an OVERLAPPING closing method it also assigns the item's closing time in asceding order.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency of the sale (capital letters: EUR, USD, etc.)

fields.name: incrementTable
fields.description:
Default increment table for the sale.
If an increment table is associated with any items in the sale
this will be overidden.

fields.name: items
fields.description: Items that have been associated with this sale.

fields.name: participants
fields.description: Get list of participants for this sale

types.name: SaleDates
types.description: Sale Dates

fields.name: closingDate
fields.description: Date of when the sale is supposed to be automatically closed.

fields.name: openDate
fields.description: Date of when the sale is supposed to be automatically opened.

types.name: SaleDatesInput
types.description: Input arguments for when creating or modifying a sale.

inputFields.name: closingDate
inputFields.description: Closing Date

inputFields.name: openDate
inputFields.description: Opening Date

types.name: SaleFilter
types.description: Sale filter for sales.

inputFields.name: statuses
inputFields.description: Filter by sale status

types.name: SaleItem
types.description: A sale item (item that has been added to a sale)

fields.name: allowedBidTypes
fields.description:
Allowed BidTypes on the item.
Currently only a single BidType is allowed per item.
Defaults to allowing only Max bids if not supplied.

fields.name: bids
fields.description: Get list of bids for this item

fields.name: currentBid
fields.description: Current bid amount for the item as minor currency unit.

fields.name: dates
fields.description: Scheduled closing timestamp for the item.

fields.name: highEstimate
fields.description: High Estimate of item in minor currency unit.

fields.name: leaderId
fields.description: Current leader (user id) for the item

fields.name: lowEstimate
fields.description: Low Estimate of item in minor currency unit.

fields.name: reserve
fields.description: Reserve on the item in minor currency unit.

fields.name: saleId
fields.description: Sale id, as items can be created without having to be associated to a sale.

fields.name: startingBid
fields.description: Starting bid for the item in minor currency unit.

fields.name: totalBids
fields.description: Number of bids that have been placed on the item

Allowed BidTypes on the item.

types.name: SaleStatus
types.description: Sale Status represent what status a sale is currently running in.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: Sale is closed for bidding.

enumValues.name: CLOSING
enumValues.description: Sale is closing .

enumValues.name: OPENED
enumValues.description: Sale is opened for bidding.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: Sale is paused.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING
enumValues.description: Sale is being processed.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED
enumValues.description: Sale has been published but is not opened for bidding.

enumValues.name: UNPUBLISHED
enumValues.description: Sale has not been published. This status will never appear in the API expcept when you are previewing the sale.

fields.name: closing
fields.description: Number of sales in a closing state

inputFields.name: accountId
inputFields.description: Account ID the sales belong to

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

Action Hook response from test message.
Contains the status code received.

Token metadata is mandatory information that needs to be included

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: Unique User ID that represents a user in customer's user database.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
